column1: If the Trump administration had a platform or plan on managing COVID - which 9 months in they still don't - its apparently to root out anyone with any competence or public trust. https://t.co/XFRtWnHAZC
Trumps tax returns are around the corner just like his healthcare plan or his COVID one. #PresidentialDebate2020 https://t.co/5A05bhPJdq
And that's with social distancing. Trump is back to likening COVID to the flu and endangering anyone who will listen. https://t.co/6w63taAhDx

Its this mentality that put Trump in the hospital in the first place and promoted a culture of skepticism that has exposed countless people to contracting COVID.  Remember Americans do not have the luxury of access to the top doctors/ experimental treatments that he's had. https://t.co/ndhbI67Zvp

CDFIs MDIs have supported low income and minority communities most devastated by COVID. But they’re disappearing at an alarming rate leaving families and businesses vulnerable to predatory lending. Grateful for the bipartisan support for my bill to help these institutions. https://t.co/704TEFDJQg

Says a lot that Republicans won't put aid for states and localities in their COVID relief bill but they'll let Trump twist federal agencies into playing out his inane politics threatening funding when people need it most.   This would be funny if it wasn't downright dangerous. https://t.co/ZswbJBh6fq

This administration's focus wasn't overcoming COVID it's focus was convincing the public the crisis wasn't happening. They allowed the pandemic to fester and as a result we are the coronavirus capital of the world. https://t.co/nGPWWwal9X

Trump downplayed COVID refused to lead a response and fueled a skepticism about the virus that allowed it to spiral out of control. Countless lives have been lost our economy's in shambles and we have the tapes to show he knew the danger all along and did worse than nothing. https://t.co/lXdIfMRT9S

On #LaborDay we remember the hard fought victories that secured a livable wage a 5 day work week family leave and all that we sometimes take for granted. But this year let’s reflect on the many inequities highlighted by COVID and create opportunities for all American workers.

As if this administration hasn't failed Americans enough with a lack of COVID strategy costing more lives and economic damage than necessary now they're pulling back on testing.  Trump's focus is sweeping the pandemic under the rug putting PR over people. https://t.co/OUIJlqo2SP

This is the result of the administration's failure to lead during a pandemic and yet another example of the United State's diminishing role as a global leader.  But more than costing us our nation's reputation Trump's  has cost us invaluable time to get COVID-19 under control. https://t.co/3CVtiyUtID

Our ports railways bridges and tunnels are critical to our economy as well as the thousands of jobs these projects generate. We cannot allow the losses caused by the coronavirus pandemic to derail our transportation system.  https://t.co/sOYGLuujah

No question federal assistance for the Port Authority is critical for the functioning of our region's economy now and after this crisis. The drop in revenue caused by COVID-19 must be mitigated immediately through federal aid. https://t.co/LSSQOojb88

Local restaurants have been devastated by COVID and they're likely to continue hurting even as our nation begins to open. I led a letter to leadership outlining what measures Congress can take next to address their specific needs. Read more here: https://t.co/LTIzWf6tMh https://t.co/SYk4b46x8D

Kushner has zero experience and should not be at the helm of this administration's coronavirus response. It takes a great deal of arrogance to discount expertise in times of crisis let alone when you're already so ill-equipped to execute on these responsibilities. https://t.co/8MAmScLBKn

Today I sent a letter to the GEO run Queens Detention Facility demanding they provide answers on how they plan to control the coronavirus outbreak at their facility and full transparency on the situation there.   See more: https://t.co/L4UGw3LPek https://t.co/GriEObD9rE

This is an absurd attempt to scapegoat and rewrite history. This administration was briefed by its own intelligence about coronavirus and ignored the ugly truth for political reasons. Cutting funding to the WHO doesn't erase that it just makes a global pandemic worse. https://t.co/BSZdnZrZgX

Structural inequities that have existed for small businesses long before COVID is now hurting their ability to receive aid. Dems are working to make sure they don't slip through the cracks.   That isn't hostage taking that's called negotiation. Read: https://t.co/RLW1CvWKF4

This administration's response is not commensurate to the state of the crisis in New York and across the United States. They continue to drag their feet and downplay the realities of coronavirus while those on the ground continue raising the alarm. https://t.co/BbusGDMVyn

Today I will cast my vote in DC to pass the $2 trillion coronavirus relief package. This bill is not perfect but it will provide immediate relief for the many people hurting as a result of coronavirus it will support for our health care workers and will help small businesses. https://t.co/ziXtAsiqBE

We're going to need swift comprehensive action in Congress to address both the health and economic consequences of coronavirus. I've released my priorities for a response package. See below: https://t.co/NuMRjEcjpx

We understand that this will not be easy but it is necessary to take all precautions right now in order to begin getting coronavirus under control and to keep families safe. Schools must be temporarily shut down. https://t.co/94o0GlKBo4

Remember to join tomorrow at 3pm for my Facebook live Q&A on Coronavirus. Meanwhile here’s a breakdown on the Families First act passed yesterday to help address the disruptions families are grappling with as a result of Coronavirus. https://t.co/MpySQQO9uO

Tonight we worked across party lines to ensure that testing is available that emergency sick leave and family leave is available for those that need it and that states are financially supported.  This is an important step towards getting coronavirus under control.
This is a smart move. We need to be prepared to take care of families struggling with the downstream effects of coronavirus. https://t.co/siH85vBfhj

Coronavirus response and precautions will inevitably complicate the Census campaign on the ground which is vital for an accurate count. It’s only reasonable to receive an extension for the 2020 Census so we have better data.   We only do this every ten years; let’s do it right. https://t.co/876yzPtKhQ

It's in everyone’s interest that coronavirus testing is made available and free that families can take emergency sick leave and that government is able to quickly respond to the public's needs.   Learn more about the #FamiliesFirst Act: https://t.co/6teYDsBlk5

There is a confirmed case of Coronavirus in Far Rockaway. I’m in communication with the Mayor’s office and will update as more information becomes available. Meanwhile I recommend everyone continue to follow CDC’s best practices. https://t.co/KfNVMXxwkk
As we're working to monitor corona virus It's helpful to practice these preventative steps recommended by the CDC to reduce risk: https://t.co/0JQzpROSu8
